segment.source: You can install Windows on factory-encrypted drives, also known as encrypted hard disk drives (eHDD).
segment.target: You can install Windows on factory-encrypted drives, also known as encrypted hard disk drives (eHDD).

segment.source: A factory-encrypted drive is a drive that is capable of full-disk encryption.
segment.target: A factory-encrypted drive is a drive that is capable of full-disk encryption.

segment.source: By default, when you install Windows on a factory-encrypted drive, Windows automatically encrypts the drive by using Trusted Computing Group (TCG) and IEEE 1667 transport encryption standards.
segment.target: By default, when you install Windows on a factory-encrypted drive, Windows automatically encrypts the drive by using Trusted Computing Group (TCG) and IEEE 1667 transport encryption standards.

segment.source: To install Windows onto a factory-encrypted drive, use the following:
segment.target: To install Windows onto a factory-encrypted drive, use the following:

segment.source: Firmware: UEFI version 2.3.1 that has been configured to use the EFI storage security protocol.
segment.target: Firmware: UEFI version 2.3.1 that has been configured to use the EFI storage security protocol.

segment.source: Hardware: a hard disk drive that is capable of using TCG and IEEE 1667 transport encryption standards.
segment.target: Hardware: a hard disk drive that is capable of using TCG and IEEE 1667 transport encryption standards.

segment.source: To use another encryption standard on your drive, you must first disable the automatic drive provisioning that Windows provides.
segment.target: To use another encryption standard on your drive, you must first disable the automatic drive provisioning that Windows provides.

segment.source: To do this on a new installation, set the Microsoft-Windows-EnhancedStorage-Adm/TCGSecurityActivationDisabled Unattend setting to true.
segment.target: To do this on a new installation, set the Microsoft-Windows-EnhancedStorage-Adm/TCGSecurityActivationDisabled Unattend setting to true.

segment.source: For more information, see the Unattended Windows Setup Reference.
segment.target: For more information, see the Unattended Windows Setup Reference.
